entry.def: Handcuffs are two metal rings which are joined together and can be locked round someone's wrists, usually by the police during an arrest.

example.ex: He was led away to jail in handcuffs.
example.tran: 他戴着手铐被送进了监狱。

entry.def: If you handcuff someone, you put handcuffs around their wrists.

example.ex: They tried to handcuff him but, despite his injuries, he fought his way free.
example.tran: 他们试图把他铐起来，但尽管有伤在身，他还是奋力挣脱了。

means.word_mean: 1. shackle that consists of a metal loop that can be locked around the wrist; usually used in pairs

sentences.en: He was taken away in handcuffs.
A policeman put handcuffs on the suspect.
sentences.cn: 一个警察给那嫌犯带上了手铐。

sentences.en: Paul was put into the cell,his wrists were finally freed from handcuffs.
sentences.cn: 保罗被关进单人牢房后,终于把手铐从他手腕上取了下来。
